string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: Which of the following is NOT a chemical element?
Mexico is located on which side of the United States of America?
The Earth is approximately how many miles away from the sun?
Which insect shorted out an early supercomputer and inspired the term "computer bug"?
Which of the following men does not have a chemical element named after him?
Which of the following landlocked countries is entirely contained within another country?
What architect designed the glass pyramid in the courtyard of the Louvre?
Who is credited with inventing the first mass-produced helicopter?
Who developed the first effective vaccine against polio?
The U.S. icon "Uncle Sam" was based on Samuel Wilson, who worked during the War of 1812 as a what?

string-array.name: answers
string-array.item: A) Magnesium:B) Chromium:C) Silicon:D) Kryton
A) South:B) North:C) East:D) West
A) 9.3 million:B) 39 million:C) 93 million:D) 193 million
A) Moth:B) Roach:C) Fly:D) Japanese beetle
A) Albert Einstein:B) Niels Bohr:C) Issac Newton:D) Enrico Fermi
A) Lesotho:B) Burkina Faso:C) Mongolia:D) Luxembourg
A) Philip Johnson:B) Le Corbusier:C) Frank Gehry:D) I.M. Pei
A) Igor Sikorsky:B) Elmer Sperry:C) Ferdinand von Zeppelin:D) Gottlieb Daimler
A) Albert Sabin:B) Niels Bohr:C) Louis Pasteur:D) Jonas Salk
A) Meat inspector:B) Mail deliverer:C) Historian:D) Weapons Mechanic
